name: Aglaonema Rotunda-Red tiger Variegated
description: Aglaonema rotundum 'Red Tiger' (also known as Aglaonema Rotunda-Red tiger Variegated) is a variegated Chinese Evergreen native to the tropical forests of Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family and features upright stems (30-60 cm tall) with large, dramatic, variegated leaves featuring striking mixes of red, pink, and green coloration. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. In tropical forests, this plant typically grows as a terrestrial understory plant, receiving filtered sunlight through the dense canopy. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors and visual interest with its variegated foliage. It's popular among houseplant enthusiasts for its colorful leaves, air-purifying qualities, and low maintenance requirements.
careTips: Keep substrate consistently moist but not waterlogged
Low to bright, indirect light preferred
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
